input:

45:59 Caption: We are watching a run-of-the-mill game with only a few moments to ignite the crowd. The players surely can surely perform better, they just need to motivate themselves. The visiting team dominated in most aspects of the game and the home side struggled to keep up. It's obvious that defence has the highest priority for the home side. The away team makes a lot of passes and attempts to maintain possession.

45:59 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. The visiting team was controlling the game most of the time. It's obvious that defence had the highest priority for the home side. The away team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an emphatic display of football mastery, Bayern Munich trounced Paderborn 6-0 in an away fixture, showcasing their formidable depth and ruthless efficiency. From the outset, the visitors sought to stamp their authority on the game, and their intentions were clear right from the first whistle.

The game commenced with Paderborn taking the kick-off and quickly firing a shot on target within the opening minute, forcing Bayern Munich to be alert. Despite this early attempt, Paderborn struggled to maintain possession as Bayern's high press and well-timed interceptions disrupted their play. A series of throw-ins for Bayern, coupled with early fouls by Paderborn, signaled the visitors' dominance in reclaiming and retaining the ball.

A notable moment arose at the 11th minute when Alban Meha of Paderborn took a long-range strike that barely missed the right post. Bayern Munich, undeterred, continued to build their attacks meticulously with Franck Ribery and Robert Lewandowski linking up well but failing to break through Paderborn's defense initially.

However, the breakthrough came in the 24th minute. After a series of neat passes, Arjen Robben lofted a superb ball into the box, which Robert Lewandowski capitalized on, slotting it into the bottom left corner to give Bayern Munich a 1-0 lead. Paderborn's subsequent kick-off did little to change the tempo of the game as Bayern resumed their aggressive yet composed attacking play.

The Bavarians doubled their lead shortly after, with Franck Ribery showing great vision to set up Lewandowski again in the 36th minute. Lewandowski displayed remarkable composure to bury the ball from close range, making it 2-0. Paderborn was left reeling from the onslaught as Bayern continued to dominate proceedings.

In the 36th minute itself, Bayern Munich struck once more. With barely time for Paderborn to regroup, Robben found space and added his name to the scoresheet, amping the scoreboard to 3-0. Paderborn, now visibly demoralized, struggled to regain a foothold in the match. Though they managed a few shots towards Manuel Neuer's goal, none posed a significant threat.

The first half concluded with Bayern firmly in control, and their fluid, relentless attack seemed poised for further dominance once play resumed. Paderborn’s defense, despite their best efforts, appeared porous against Bayern’s sharp incursions and swift counter-attacks.

The second half began with Bayern Munich again in possession, and similar to the first half, they swiftly took charge. Paderborn’s attempts to regain control were continually thwarted by Bayern's disciplined midfield and clinical defense. Following a series of fouls and free-kicks, the game witnessed a pivotal turning point when Paderborn’s Florian Hartherz received a red card for a reckless challenge in the 17th minute, reducing Paderborn to ten men. This not only saw them further weakened defensively but also presented Bayern Munich with a penalty.

Arjen Robben stepped up to convert the penalty with confident aplomb, sending the ball into the left side of the net and making it 4-0. Bayern Munich showed no mercy despite their significant lead. Arjen Robben continued to probe and torment Paderborn’s defense, with Franck Ribery providing the assists with exceptional precision.

The home side, now a man down, found it increasingly difficult to contain Bayern Munich’s onslaught. Substitutions on both sides aimed at shaking things up saw little change in momentum. Bayern introduced Sebastian Rode and Mitchell Weiser, both of whom immediately made an impact, with Rode assisting Weiser for the fifth goal in the 33rd minute.

Paderborn's attempts to stage a comeback were futile, with Bayern's defense quickly shutting down any promising moves. Additionally, every corner and free-kick Paderborn managed to win was effectively neutralized by Bayern's well-organized defensive units led by Neuer, who marshaled his backline with authority.

Sebastian Rode, fresh on the pitch, displayed his attacking prowess by linking up with Mitchell Weiser who beautifully chipped over Paderborn’s keeper into the bottom right corner, amplifying Bayern’s lead to a monumental 5-0. The relentless pressure applied by Bayern Munich highlighted their intention to leave no room for any Paderborn resurgence.

Even as the game drew towards its close, Bayern Munich maintained their relentless assault, with Robben securing his brace by latching onto a brilliant pass and slotting home with composed finish into the bottom right corner, sealing the 6-0 scoreline. Paderborn’s defenses were left in tatters as Robben's goal encapsulated Bayern's comprehensive control over the match.

As the final whistle blew, bringing the match to a much-awaited end for the home side, Bayern Munich's dominance was not merely reflected in the scoreline but in their overall gameplay. The statistics spoke volumes about their superiority, with Bayern enjoying a large share of possession and attempting numerous shots on target. Paderborn's limited offensive efforts were consistently thwarted by Bayern's rock-solid defense and the ever-vigilant Neuer. 

Overall, the game was a testament to Bayern Munich's attacking prowess and tactical discipline, showcasing why they are one of the top sides in European football. Both individually and collectively, they outclassed Paderborn, who despite having spells of possession, never looked likely to challenge their dominance. Paderborn’s fans left the stadium in dismay, having witnessed a humbling defeat at the hands of a far superior team.

This commanding performance by Bayern serves as a reminder of their potential and capabilities, setting the stage for what looks to be another promising season. For Paderborn, the match provided harsh lessons in both defensive organization and dealing with top-tier opposition. Each Bayern goal was a display of their clinical finishing and ability to capitalize on defensive lapses, leaving the Paderborn management with much to ponder moving forward.

Bayern Munich’s ruthless execution and strategic play were key takeaways from this fixture, underscoring their ambitions for the league title. With players like Robben, Ribery, and Lewandowski in peak form, they remain a formidable force, capable of dismantling any defense put in front of them.
